sense.name: to accuse, condemn or judge as wrong
sense.examples: Signs, placards, and graffiti drawn on walls and pavements denounced the invaders. The opposition parties denounced it as a sell-out. The paper regularly runs editorials denouncing her for marrying a foreigner.

sense.name: formally announce the termination of an agreement
sense.examples: This treaty may be denounced by any contracting party by notification. Winston Churchill denounced the agreement in the House of Commons.
